title._content: [Portrait of Buddy De Franco and Mrs. Buddy De Franco, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Buddy De Franco and Mrs. Buddy De Franco, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Buddy De Franco, clarinetist formerly with Boyd Raeburn, carries a small organ with him when traveling. Here he goes over some music in his hotel room while his wife is in the background. The organ and the De Francos may now be on their way west. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 106 Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Organ part of Buddy's baggage," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 19 (Sept. 10, 1947), p. 3. Subjects: De Franco, Buddy, 1923- De Franco, Mrs. Buddy Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Clarinetists--1940-1950. Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.10831 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 1083
